title: Anomalies in Giza pyramid may indicate an unknown entrance
summary: Two voids found on the eastern face of Menkaure's pyramid may indicate the presence of a second entrance.

title: 'The universe will just get colder and deader from now on': Euclid telescope confirms star formation has already peaked in the cosmos
summary: Astronomers using data from ESA's Euclid and Herschel space telescopes have confirmed that star formation has already peaked in the cosmos, and that the universe is bound to get steadily 'colder and deader' from here on.

title: Scientists may finally have an explanation for the centuries-old 5,200 mystery holes in the Peruvian Andes
summary: Drone footage and on-the-ground excavations high in the Andes are revealing what the Chincha Kingdom and Inca Empire may have used these holes for centuries ago.

title: Ram-shaped teapot from ancient Canaanite cult discovered near ancient city of Armageddon
summary: Archaeologists have discovered a ram-shaped tea pot and one of the oldest old wine presses in the world that date to the time of the Canaanites during the Bronze Age.

title: Unprecedented radio view of the Milky Way took over 40,000 hours to construct — Space photo of the week
summary: Created using data from two extensive surveys, this spectacular radio image of the galactic plane of the Milky Way provides valuable insights into the birth and death of stars.

title: The Hidden Math of Ocean Waves
summary: The math behind even the simplest ocean waves is notoriously uncooperative. A team of Italian mathematicians has made major advances toward understanding it.

title: 'The images could be much older': Analysis of rocks shows Neanderthals made art at least 64,000 years ago
summary: Art has sometimes thought to be exclusive to modern humans.

title: Trump’s Hatred of EVs Is Making Gas Cars More Expensive
summary: Trump’s anti-climate agenda is making it more expensive to own a car, period.

title: 'Unlike any we've ever seen': Record-breaking black hole eruption is brighter than 10 trillion suns
summary: Astronomers spotted a flaring black hole that may be consuming a star at least 30 times more massive than the sun. At its peak, the flare was brighter than 10 trillion stars.

title: 13th-century Christian songbook made of furry sealskin may be Norway's oldest surviving book
summary: Experts at the National Library of Norway believe the liturgical songbook was made by a local artisan around A.D. 1200.

title: Triple Divide Peak: Montana's unique liquid 'crossroads' where water can flow into three oceans
summary: Triple Divide Peak in Montana is the only place on Earth where water can flow into one of three different oceans, according to some definitions.

title: Can you speak cat? Scientists develop quiz that reveals how well you understand our feline friends
summary: Cats are excellent at communicating, but humans still routinely misunderstand them.

title: Archaeologists find 'unique' blood-red gemstone at Roman fort beyond Hadrian's Wall
summary: Archaeologists discovered the engraved gemstone at Bremenium, a fort north of Hadrian's Wall.

title: How to Follow the Trajectory of Comet 3I/Atlas
summary: The interstellar comet 3I/Atlas reached its closest point to the sun. Here's how to follow the rest of its journey away from our solar system.

title: International PhD student numbers in US hold steady — for now
summary:
Nature, Published online: 07 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03653-w

Trend flies in face of Trump-administration policies, but could yet see a rapid decrease, especially in science fields.
body: Nature, Published online: 07 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03653-w Trend flies in face of Trump-administration policies, but could yet see a rapid decrease, especially in science fields.

title: Roman road network was twice as large as previously thought, new mapping project finds
summary: The new digital map increases the Roman road network by nearly 100%.

title: Scientists finally find explanation for lopsided cloud that follows Earth's moon through space
summary: The moon's oddly skewed dust cloud may be caused by an extreme day-night temperature difference, a new study suggests.

title: Global warming is forcing Earth's systems toward 'doom loop' tipping points. Can we avoid them?
summary: Earth may be on the verge of crossing several climate change tipping points that could have irreversible and devastating consequences. Here's everything you need to know about these "points of no return."

title: 20% off ALL Unistellar smart telescopes throughout November
summary: Save up to a huge $1,000 on all Unistellar telescopes and accessories this November in their Black Friday deal — just in time for dark sky season.

title: Astronomers discover bizarre 'runaway' planet that's acting like a star, eating 6 billion tons per second
summary: The James Webb and Very Large telescopes spotted a free-floating planet accreting material at a record rate, displaying behavior similar to how stars form. Scientists aren't clear as to why.

title: James Webb telescope makes first 3D map of an alien planet's atmosphere
summary: Astronomers using the James Webb Space Telescope have made the first 3D map of an alien planet's atmosphere, revealing extreme temperature swings on the exoplanet WASP-18b.

title: It's official: The world will speed past 1.5 C climate threshold in the next decade, UN says
summary: The UNEP's 2025 Emissions Gap report has found that global average temperatures will exceed 1.5 C (2.7 F) before 2035 — and this just days before the COP30 climate summit kicks off in Brazil.

title: 'Not so exotic anymore': The James Webb telescope is unraveling the truth about the universe's first black holes
summary: A peculiar object discovered by the James Webb Space Telescope just 700 million years after the Big Bang could reveal the origins of the earliest black holes in the universe, some experts say.

title: China should undertake more risky research to close the Nobel gap
summary:
Nature, Published online: 04 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03615-2

China should undertake more risky research to close the Nobel gap
body: Nature, Published online: 04 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03615-2 China should undertake more risky research to close the Nobel gap

title: How I’m helping to cultivate science entrepreneurship in Brazil
summary:
Nature, Published online: 04 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03323-x

A course on disruptive innovation, and a supportive professional network, helped to unleash João Paulo Longo’s entrepreneurship skills.
body: Nature, Published online: 04 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03323-x A course on disruptive innovation, and a supportive professional network, helped to unleash João Paulo Longo’s entrepreneurship skills.

title: "سبيس إكس" تقترح على ناسا خطة لإرسال البشر إلى القمر
summary: أعلنت شركة سبيس إكس، المملوكة للملياردير الأميركي إيلون ماسك، الخميس، أنها اقترحت على إدارة الطيران والفضاء الأميركية (ناسا) خطة مبسطة لإرسال البشر إلى القمر.

title: سرقة اللوفر.. توقيف مشتبه بهما ومحاولة هروب من المطار
summary: أوقفت السلطات الفرنسية رجلين، مساء السبت، في إطار التحقيق في سرقة مجوهرات تاريخية من متحف اللوفر في باريس يوم 19 أكتوبر الجاري، وفق ما أكد مصدران مطلعان مؤكدين معلومات أوردتها وسائل إعلام محلية، الأحد.
